medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been admitted to an outside institution earlier this year with severe left lower quadrant discomfort. A CT scan at that time showed fluid collections associated with the sigmoid colon, suggestive of a contained perforation. The patient recovered with antibiotic therapy, and the fluid collections resolved. An attempt at colonoscopy failed due to a sigmoid stricture. A virtual colonoscopy showed thickening of the sigmoid colon. The patient's condition prompted a second opinion, leading to recommendations for a definitive colectomy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant for a long history of cigarette smoking (one pack per day) and presumed elements of COPD. Past surgeries include unilateral salpingo-oophorectomy for a benign cyst and breast augmentation. There is a question of a right lower lobe lung nodule.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for lung cancer in her mother, who was a cigarette smoker. No family history of colon, ovarian, or breast cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Current smoking of one pack per day.
